text: IronPython For Unit Testing over C#
We know that Python provides a  lot of productivity over any compiled languages.
We have programming in C# & need to write the unit test cases in C# itself.
If we see the amount of code we write for unit test is approximately ten times more than the original code.
Is it ideal choice to write unit test cases in IronPython instead of C#?
Any body has done like that?
I wrote few test cases, they seems to be good.
But hairy pointy managers won't accept.
